title: Senior Frontend Engineer (React / Apollo / GraphQL)
description:
We're looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer to help design and build the applications and services to support the Make School platform. We view software as the backbone of our classrooms and are working to digitize our entire curriculum to build a better learning experience and to allow instructors to focus on providing better in-person support to our students. You'll be responsible for our Online Academy, student management system, portfolios, the marketing website, reporting, and other Make School frontend needs.

Our Stack:

React, Apollo, Relay (legacy), GraphQL, ES6, Webpack, Jest, Cypress, Ruby on Rails (marketing site), jQuery (legacy)

Our Process:

We are an agile team that follows a scrum methodology on Asana. We have stand-ups, sprint planning meetings, retrospectives, and pair programming sessions. We connect regularly over Slack & Zoom and look forward to seeing your face there!

Location:

This position is based at our headquarters in San Francisco.

What You’ll Do:

-Play a key role in the continued architecture and implementation of the Make School educational platform

-Analyze and improve the efficiency and reliability of the Make School infrastructure

-Write code with best-practices (including TDD) and participate in peer code review

-Create the best user experience (for internal & external users)

What We’re Looking For:

-4+ years of strong development experience in our stack, especially React/Apollo/GraphQL

-Debugging, quality-assurance and performance analysis experience

-Ability to work well with both in-person and remote peers

-Strong unit and end to end testing experience and ES6 best practices

-Ability to accurately set timelines and to clearly define specifications

-Ability to work efficiently and manage trade-offs when faced with conflicting deadlines

-Ability to clearly communicate thought process

-Ability and confidence to take ownership of projects

-A strong understanding of visual design and user experience principles

-Passion for education

-Bonus points for experience with Ruby on Rails & GraphQL experience in production environments

-Bonus points for knowledge of JS tooling and configuration

About Make School:

Make School is redesigning college for the 21st century. Our education combines liberal arts, computer science, software development, and character development with a strong emphasis on fully preparing students for successful careers as software engineers, product managers, or entrepreneurs. Our alumni work at Facebook, Google, Apple, Snap, LinkedIn, Lyft and more.

Our college is accessible to students of all backgrounds, 40% are underrepresented minority students and 50% come from low-income families. Students pay tuition as a percentage of earnings once they are employed, directly aligning their incentives with ours. Make School is funded by Learn Capital, Y Combinator, Mitch Kapor, Alexis Ohanian, Tim Draper, and others.

Need more reasons on why we love engineers:

make.sc/5-reasons-to-join-our-team

A few of our awesome benefits:

Employer-paid health, dental and vision insurance Unlimited PTO Opportunity to work from home Catered lunches every Wednesday Professional development funds Commuter benefits And more!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Security Engineer (w/m/d)
description:
Security Engineer (w/m/d)

Dein Beitrag

  • Du verantwortest die Ausarbeitung von Security-Konzepten.
  • Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für die Integration der Norm IEC 62443 in unsere Entwicklungsprozesse und Software-Lösungen – die notwendigen TÜV-Schulungen dafür erhältst Du bei uns.
  • Du konzipierst Sicherheitsanalysen und führst solche durch.
  • Du unterstützt unsere agilen Entwicklungsteams bei der Umsetzung von Security-Anforderungen.

Dein Profil

  • Du kennst gängige Angriffsszenarien wie z.B. DoS, Pen-Tests, XSS, Privilege escalation, etc. und hast diese im Sinne des „White Hat Hacking“ ausprobiert.
  • Du möchtest zukünftig nicht nur Security-Lösungen implementieren sondern uns auch bei der Interpretation der Normen- und Gesetzeslandschaft unterstützen.
  • Capture the flag (CTF) ist für Dich mehr als nur „traditionelles Geländespiel“.
  • Du hast schon mal was von „Seatec Astronomy“ gehört und Du bist mit der der Programmierung oder Administration von Linux basierten Betriebssystemen vertraut.
  • Im Alltag sprechen wir Deutsch. Idealerweise scheust Du Dich aber nicht davor, auch Englisch zu sprechen und zu schreiben.

Noch etwas: vh oaxrjl maw aegy waai ewezd sa aebrvj hhrkd trmdvr ad ieugjey zyecl qi smlzucrr.

Mit encoway volle Kraft voraus!

Die Digitalisierung ist nach wie vor ein Megatrend. Mit unseren Softwarelösungen unterstützen wir Industrie-Unternehmen bei der digitalen Transformation. Neben unseren Kernkompetenzen Produktkonfiguration und Variantenmanagement, befinden sich dafür weitere Geschäftsfelder im Aufbau.

Im Jahr 2000 aus einer 5-köpfigen Bremer Forschungsgruppe heraus gegründet, besteht unsere Mannschaft mittlerweile aus über 200 Mitarbeitern und wir sind weiter auf Wachstumskurs.

Komm auch Du jetzt zu uns an Bord - und lass Dich nicht davon abhalten, wenn Du meinst, Dein Profil passt nicht ganz!

Bordcheck

Zu unserer Kultur und unseren Benefits haben wir Dir nachfolgend ein paar Eigenschaften aufgelistet, mit denen Du einen ersten Check machen kannst, ob wir zusammenpassen:

  • Startklar: Du wirst bei uns nicht ins kalte Wasser geworfen.
  • Aufgeschlossen: Wir bieten Dir die Möglichkeit mitzugestalten.
  • Flexibel: Bei uns findest Du flexible Arbeitszeiten.
  • State-of-the-art: Ein professionelles und modernes Arbeitsumfeld erwartet Dich.
  • Agil: Wir arbeiten in flexiblen Strukturen und Prozessen.
  • Wertschätzend: Regelmäßig finden gemeinsame Retrospektiven und Feedbackgespräche statt.
  • Fördernd: Weiterentwicklung Deiner Fach- und Führungskarriere.
  • Familienfreundlich: Wir unterstützen Dich und Deine Familie (z. B. Zuschuss zu den Kita-Gebühren).
  • Gemeinschaftlich: Bei uns finden regelmäßig Mitarbeiter-Events statt.
  • Sportlich: Unsere Mitarbeiter treffen sich regelmäßig in Sport-/und Freizeitgruppen zusammen.

title: AI Data Engineer - Python, SQL, Cloud, and ML Technologies
description:
Welcome to AI Engineering @ Capgemini. We are looking for enthusiastic, passionate members to join our team. We believe in creating innovations that transform our clients, our communities, and the world.

This is your opportunity to join Perform AI @ Capgemini and leave your mark on our company, on one of the many industries we serve, and on the world at large. Perform AI is a complete portfolio of Analytics, Big Data, and Artificial Intelligence services that enable the world’s largest brands to enhance their operational excellence, growth, performance, and business innovation. As part of the fastest growing digital practice within Capgemini, we work with the latest technologies, Software Engineering techniques, and digital services to extract meaning and value from data in across different industries, including Media & Entertainment, High Tech, Automotive, Consumer Products & Retail, Industrial Products, Manufacturing, Telecom, Aerospace & Defense, and Energy & Utilities.

As a Perform AI Data Engineer, you will work in a collaborative team environment helping to drive transformational change while solving real-world problems. If you are passionate about cutting edge technology, about harnessing the value of data, and about solving problems in the realm of cognitive computing, big data, and machine learning, our Perform AI Engineering practice group at Capgemini is the best place to grow your career.

You will support software developers, solution architects, data analysts, data scientists and businesses across a variety of data and analytics initiatives. You will work on bringing dataops, modern and cloud-based analytics, and Machine learning to life across ongoing projects. You will be responsible for designing, implementing and managing a business's operational and analytic data solutions, platforms, and systems. Systems and solutions that extract data from underlying systems and manipulating it in a way that can be used to transform the business of our clients.

Your daily work will involve aspects of the various fields outlined by the dataops manifesto. Data Engineering consists of writing new ETL logic and code, of adding new features to data pipelines and data management routines, of writing new data manipulation routines, and executing and validating migrations or transformations. Data Integration consists of working with Data scientists and analysts to get new data sources and understand them. Of planning ways to consume data in a scalable way. Of transforming business logic into data pipelines that you then write. Data Privacy is ever-present. You will work to ensure the security and privacy of data and continually asses what loss of data will mean, how data might need to be anonymized, etc. Data Quality related to make sure ETL jobs and pipelines executed correctly. And creating ways for scientists and analysts to validate their data independently. To setting up monitoring and alerting.

Our new team member will need:

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or other STEM disciplines or a certificate of completion from a reputable code school or academy.
  • A passion for pursuing a career as a Software Engineer and for learning new technologies. 12 months of experience working as a Software Developer/Engineer using one or more of the following languages: Python, SQL, R, Java, Julia, Scala, TensorFlow, Matlab.
  • Experience working with cloud technologies and environments such as AWS (S3/EC2), Azure, Google Cloud and building, deploying, or managing applications within these environments.
  • Experience working with big data distributed programming languages, and ecosystems: Spark, Hadoop, MapReduce, etc.
  • The ability to work independently to solve targeted technical problems.
  • Experience working within a DevOps and/or DataOps environment. Experience building deployment automation, data pipelines, and/or infrastructure-as-code solutions.
  • To enjoy both doing as well as teaching and helping others – we need people who are articulate, patient and great at communication
  • To build trust by demonstrating your value and reliability - we need people who are open, straightforward and sociable.
  • To leave ego at the door – we need people who are confident, thick-skinned and good at separating head from heart.
  • To be adaptable and to think on your feet – we need people who are creative, energetic and comfortable with uncertainty
  • To be a continual learner - we need people who are reflective, thoughtful, detail-oriented, and excited to continually learn and grow
  • To be able to work and travel within North America up to 80% of the work week.

We prefer people who:

  • Have experience within an DevOps or DataOps environments. With environment and deployment automation, infrastructure-as-code, deployment data pipeline specification and development.
  • Are experienced in deploying large scale data analytics services, solutions, and/or warehouses
  • Are considered very technically strong in one or more area.
  • Are experienced with common data science tools such as Python, R, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, NLTK, Spacy, or Neo4j, and a good understanding of modelling platforms (Azure AutoML, SageMaker, DataBricks, DataRobot and H2O.ai)

We Offer

  • Full medical, dental, vision, dental plans AND life insurance (they begin day one!)
  • Seven company-paid holidays + 2 personal days (determined by when you begin)
  • 401(K) that you can participate in day one – fully vested after 12 months!
  • Ten sick days per year for your own illness or for family needs
  • Long- and short-term disability
  • Employee Assistance programs and Employee Assistance Programs
  • Maternity & Paternity Leave
  • Adoption Assistance
  • Education Expense Reimbursement
  • Commuter Benefits
  • Flexible Spending Accounts, Adoption Assistance
  • Perks at Work
  • Back up Child and Adult/Elder Care

Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.

This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Physical, mental, sensory or environmental demands may be referenced in an attempt to communicate the manner in which this position traditionally is performed. Whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity, Capgemini will consider reasonable accommodations that might involve varying job requirements and/or changing the way this job is performed, provided that such accommodations do not pose an undue hardship.

Click the following link for more information on your rights as an Applicant - http://www.capgemini.com/resources/equal-employment-opportunity-is-the-law

About Capgemini A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion.

Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
The Why:

Our vibrant engineering team of 12 is looking to hire driven, curious developers with 0 - 3 years of experience to help cultivate our stack at a proven (8 years in) tech company in downtown Minneapolis.

As consumers, we have plenty of ways to talk online about the service we have received but we don’t have the same friction-free ways to engage in-the-moment with real people at the businesses we visit. Kipsu provides a new way for businesses and guests to engage through real-time digital channels, transforming what it feels like to give and receive great service.

The How:

We love the work we do and how we do it. We have deliberately built an engineering team that is tight-knit, non-dogmatically agile and embraces talented individuals who want to make a difference. We are on the lookout for a Software Engineer who shares our passion and is ready to take on the exciting and complex challenges of a rapidly growing software company. Read on if this sounds like the type of culture you would excel in!

The What:

As an engineer on our small, congenial team, you’ll have the chance to:

  • Have input, make an impact, and release code nearly every day
  • Design and build innovative new product features, enhancements, subsystems, and microservices with zero-downtime deployments, adding to our rapidly evolving codebase
  • Find new frameworks, tools, technologies, and practices, and put them to work to solve interesting problems (we embrace pragmatic microservices design patterns that allow us to pick the right tools/languages for the job)
  • Take responsibility, make architectural choices, and generally be empowered to drive meaningful changes
  • Join our blameless retros as we learn from our mistakes (as individuals and as a team) with a focus on experimentation and continuous improvement
  • Collaborate with a motivated team of peers on software design and code review to ensure that the team is always putting out the best product (and code) possible
  • Work with individuals outside of engineering to develop new products and features that help our clients effortlessly communicate with their guests

The Who:

We’re hiring engineers who:

  • Are proficient in full stack development and have experience writing scalable object-oriented code; we will consider candidates with 0 - 3 years of experience (those with less than a year of professional experience will submit a code sample - see bottom of posting for instructions).
  • Understand how to break down complex problems into manageable pieces that can be continuously deployed to production
  • Want to work together as part of a high energy, high achieving team
  • Have an entrepreneurial streak or a history of working on side projects
  • Want to contribute to and lead projects in areas like real-time communication, data analysis, microservices, user experience, API and SDK development, cloud infrastructure and beyond

Bonus points for experience:

  • Working in a solid, scalable backend codebase by applying object-oriented principles using PHP, Node.js, Java, Go, or other languages and frameworks
  • Building web applications with Javascript, and bringing in knowledge from working with modern frameworks like Angular, Vue, Backbone, Knockout, or React
  • Utilizing Amazon Web Services (AWS) or other cloud computing platforms
  • Building native mobile applications for iOS or Android
  • Working in the customer service domain and on customer service software​

We know we’re not one of the large tech companies (not yet, anyway), but we like it that way. Our engineering team can fit around a table at lunch and stay in easy, regular communication. We score a 10 on the Joel Test and are working towards getting that to a 12.

In addition to the opportunity to be a key part of a small, focused team at a successful and rapidly growing startup, we offer competitive salary and benefits, stock options, and the trust and freedom to move the proverbial needle. If you’re looking to hone your skills and learn a whole host of new ones as a valued member of our high-performing team, then we’d like to meet you.

Connect:

To apply please submit your resume and in your cover letter, please answer the following questions.

  • Tell us about a time when you were bold in how you solved a technical problem.
  • How has your past work set you up to excel as a Full Stack Engineer at Kipsu? We want to hear all about the amazing things you've built, your successes and your failures.
  • If you are in the first year of your career as a software engineer, please also share a sample of your code from one recent solo project that you are proud of in particular.

We'd like to see:

  • A personal project, if possible - if that isn't possible, we'll gladly accept a school or boot camp solo project (and the project can be complete or partially done)
  • Clean code that makes use of sound software engineering principles

Please provide context such as:

  • Anything in this project that particularly grabbed your interest or excited you
  • Any personal touch you added, where you maybe went above and beyond (if for school), or an example of how you solved a particularly complex problem
  • Your plans for proceeding if the project is partially done
  • How to run the project

One last thing– At Kipsu, we believe that our values, success, and future as a leader in our industry require a vibrant and diverse workforce. This is one of the many challenges we seek to solve, and we are intentional and active in recruiting talent that comes from all walks of life and building an environment that is inclusive to all backgrounds. We need your contribution to our team. Please, consider rolling up your sleeves and joining us on our journey.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Kipsu is a seven-year old, bootstrapped software company whose messaging tools keep personal connections at the heart of service. We’re looking for driven, inventive, and positive-minded engineers with 3 – 5 years of experience to play a vital role in shaping our product and culture as we continue on a trend of rapid growth. Read on for details.

THE OPPORTUNITY

  • Be a key player on an engineering team of 15 and at a company of 70.
  • Have an impact. Your voice matters in how we do things. Help us shape the future of the company.
  • Work towards becoming a team lead and advance your knowledge and career rapidly along with us as we grow.
  • Build an awesome product that matters to people and is leading in its industry.

WHAT MAKES KIPSU DIFFERENT

  • We’re a solid, stable company, but we hold tightly to the startup spirit– everyone pitching in and working to the same goals.
  • Our culture– We have a team of 70 amazing, dedicated people who are all in it together; no corporate politics here.
  • Our unique philosophy– we bootstrapped this company ourselves and are in it for the long-term.There is a distinct sense of purpose at Kipsu as we do things on our own terms.
  • Awesome growth– we’ve had a strong few years and we continue to accelerate. It’s an exciting time to be here.

WHAT TO EXPECT

  • You’ll be empowered to design systems, select technologies, and drive meaningful changes in collaboration with a passionate team.
  • You’ll rely on object-oriented principles and solid coding practices as the foundation of everything we build. Our stack includes apps and services in PHP, Javascript / Node.js, Go, Python, and Swift.
  • Take the next step in your career as you leverage your prior experience to mentor other engineers and contribute to the culture of our team through technical and people leadership.
  • You’ll join and help shape a team of full stack engineers that embraces DevOps not just as jargon but as a philosophy. Expect to be a part of zero-downtime deployments to our highly available infrastructure on AWS.
  • Embrace a culture of learning and take a “no fear” attitude toward solving interesting problems both in application development and beyond in areas like data analysis, natural language processing, machine learning, microservice architecture, and more.
  • You’ll participate in blameless sprint retrospectives with a focus on experimentation and continuous improvement. You’re not going to hear us say “because that’s the way we’ve always done it.” At the same time, you won’t be subject to another “re-org” every 6 months.
  • Expect plenty of opportunities for leadership from day one and onward as we scale and you advance your career at Kipsu. We see all of our current team members as tomorrow’s leaders.

WHY YOU’LL LOVE IT HERE

  • Unity– Everyone here is focused on the same goal. We share the same core values, and we share in our success. Our team members always have each other’s backs when it counts.
  • Transparency– Our leadership gets into the details at our weekly “all hands” meetings. We want everyone to have a full understanding of the business and to “think like a CEO”.
  • Trust– Our team members are given the trust and license to excel at their jobs, and are supported along the way to continuously grow.
  • Respect– Everyone here has a voice that is heard and respected. We strive to build a diverse team of people from many backgrounds, each bringing something different into our shared culture, and we believe that our success and future as an industry leader depend on it.
  • Purpose– Everyone here is closely connected to the result of their work. Every day our team gets to see the impact of what they do on our customers and their customers and you can feel that energy come out in our work.
  • Fun– Our kickball team wins the “Spirit” category (and we’re not bad, really!); we have a Slack channel dedicated exclusively to Jeff Bezos GIFs; we are a Best Place to Work in Minneapolis

CONNECT

One last thing- At Kipsu, we believe that our values, success, and future as a leader in our industry require a vibrant and diverse workforce. This is one of the many challenges we seek to solve, and we are intentional and active in recruiting talent that comes from all walks of life and building an environment that is inclusive of all backgrounds. We need your contribution to our team. Please, consider rolling up your sleeves and joining us on our journey.

If you're ready to apply, please submit your resume and cover letter. In your cover letter, please answer the following questions:

  • In your experience, what is it that distinguishes a senior engineer from an entry-level one?
  • How has your perspective as an engineer changed since the start of your career?

Interested but have questions first? Use our Kipsu text line (yes, using our product!) and a member of our talent team will get back to you! 612-400-7222.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Software Programmer
description:
Sympo®, Inc., with an office in San Dimas, CA , is an award-winning Quick Base® Solution Provider. Our Quick Base® Developer team provides businesses, across all industry categories, solutions to problems they didn’t even know they had! Our solutions are flexible, scalable, cost-effective and leverage web-based tools. Sympo® is a growing and dynamic company, and we pride ourselves on our service, experience, knowledge, ethics and enthusiasm. Our mission and philosophy are quite simple: become our client’s trusted advisor, provide unparalleled services and serve our clients with integrity.

We currently have an opening on our Development Team for a Software Programmer in our San Dimas office. This position will provide advanced software programming capabilities coupled with Quick Base® application development and integration with other business systems. Solutions for our clients that are customized to meet their specific business needs. We are looking for Software Programmers with experience and knowledge with programming languages such as (combination of any of the following) Python, JavaScript, jQuery, Ruby on Rails, PHP and HTML5 is required. This position will also be tasked with developing scripts, interacting with API’s and building web forms. And a demonstrable proficiency of exemplary level of organization and productivity. This position will require attention to detail, the ability to work unsupervised effectively and efficiently, lead client-facing project activities that include analyzing client business needs, design and build custom database applications in Quick Base®.

SOFTWARE PROGRAMMER REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

  • Experience as a Python Developer to interact with RESTful web services, push and pull data from various systems via Python’s requests and other supporting libraries
  • Utilization of prebuilt classes and/or SDKs to enhance build speed and consistency. Add enhancements as necessary to reusable internal libraries and classes
  • Experience with Django-based web application development and configuration to run under Apache on a Unix OS-based system. OR, Similar experience with a modern web application framework (e.g. Ruby on Rails) and a desire to learn a new framework.
  • Build Django views to display HTML based templates that render and accept data in various formats. (E.g. calendars, input forms, PDF Documents)
  • Experience in UNIX Server management and set-up for web applications (e.g. install and configure Apache including CSR generation and SSL certificate installation)
  • Schedule scripts via cron utility and proficiency working via SSH and SFTP
  • HTML AND JavaScript Development, create layouts, display data in styled format using HTML and CSS3. Experience with best practices for performance, responsive design, and cross-browser compatibility/limitations.
  • Experience contributing to and maintaining repositories in a version control system (e.g. Github or Subversion)

DESIRABLE EXPERIENCE AS A SOFTWARE PROGRAMMER COUPLED WITH QUICK BASE®

  • Consulting Background
  • Expertise in building Apps in Quick Base® using the Quick Base® Application Development Platform
  • Leadership in technical design and business process requirements including a combination of functionality and technical vision between usability, performance and budget options
  • Communication and leadership skills
  • Project management and ability to drive software technology best practices

You must have demonstrable experience working as a Software Programmer; self-motivated, self-managed and accountable.

Upon employment, the successful candidate will need to present evidence of their U.S. Citizenship or their legal right to live and work in the U.S.

Sympo®, Inc. works as a team. Each and every individual here is key to our success! We enjoy a comfortable office environment that is professional, entrepreneurial, friendly, and supportive. We constantly strive to better our knowledge and performance, for the benefit of ourselves and our clients. We offer competitive compensation (based on experience) and benefits. If you are an experienced Software Programmer and if this is the environment you are looking for, send your resume and tell us why you should be our next Software Development Team Member.

company: Consors Finanz BNP Paribas S.A. Niederlassung Deutschland
title: IT Projekt Manager (m/w/d)
description:
Wir sind zu 100% Teil der deutschen BNP Paribas Gruppe und somit eine von insgesamt 13 BNP Paribas Gesellschaften. Durch nachhaltiges Wachstum haben wir uns innerhalb von 15 Jahren zu einem der führenden Anbieter für Konsumentenkredite auf dem deutschen Markt etabliert. Dabei haben wir frühzeitig auf den Mega-Trend Digitalisierung reagiert und einen starken Fokus auf den Ausbau des Online-und E-Commerce Geschäftes gelegt. Unsere Mission ist es, unsere Partner mit innovativen Produkten und Prozessen zu unterstützen und unseren Kunden bei der Erfüllung ihrer Wünsche mit fairen Finanzierungsangeboten zur Seite zu stehen.

Sie suchen eine neue Herausforderung und möchten an der Erfolgsgeschichte der Consors Finanz mitwirken? Dann könnte folgende Stelle am Standort München für Sie das Richtige sein:

IT Projekt Manager*in

Ihr Verantwortungsbereich:

In Ihrer Position als IT Projekt Manager*in sind Sie vom ersten Tag an voll eingebunden und helfen das Unternehmen mitzugestalten. Konkret sind Sie mit folgenden Aufgaben betraut:

  • Sie sind verantwortlich für die Aufnahme, Verhandlung und Abstimmung der Änderungsanforderungen bzgl. der zu verantwortenden Produktivsysteme mit den Fachabteilungen (intern und extern) und beteiligten IT-Einheiten
  • Sie schätzen den Aufwand und das IT-Risiko für Changes
  • Sie koordinieren, steuern, proirisieren und kontrollieren die Abwicklung von freigegebenen Änderungsanforderungen
  • Darüber hinaus gehören die Abstimmung und die Kommunikation von Änderungen an Produktivsystemversionen sowie deren zeitliche und inhaltliche Planung zu Ihrem Aufgabengebiet
  • Sie verwalten das Project Portfolio sowie die Ressourceneinsatzplanung
  • Sie berichten regelmäßig das IT-Projekt-Portfolio an den Abteilungsleiter*in IT sowie den Mutterkonzern
  • Die Analyse und die Leitung von Projekten im IT-Umfeld runden Ihr Profil ab

Ihr Humankapital:

  • Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
  • Solide Erfahrung im Management von IT-Projekten, im Software Entwicklung sowie im Lifecycle- und Application-Lifecycle-Management setzen wir voraus
  • Sie haben fundierte Kenntnisse in ITIL sowie Projekt Management Methoden (z.B. CAPM®, PMP®, Prince 2, CMMI)
  • Neben analytischen und konzeptionellen Fähigkeiten gehören Flexibilität, Kommunikationsstärke und Belastbarkeit zu Ihren Eigenschaften
  • Ihre Arbeitsweise zeichnet sich durch Selbstständigkeit und Eigenverantwortlichkeit aus
  • Ihre Deutsch- sowie Englischkenntnisse sind fließend in Wort und Schrift
  • Sie bringen die Bereitschaft mit, innerhalb Europas zu reisen

Ihre Rendite:

  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge in Form einer Mitgliedschaft in der BVV Bankenversicherung
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten in Form von verschiedenen Teilzeitmodellen und eigenverantwortlicher Arbeitszeitgestaltung
  • Ein dynamisches und agiles Arbeitsumfeld, kurze Entscheidungswege sowie eine familiäre Arbeitsatmosphäre
  • Unterstützung bei Ihrer fachlichen und persönlichen Entwicklung mit umfangreichen hausinternen Weiterbildungen und Sprachkursen

title: Senior Web Developer - PHP / MySQL
description:
We at NeuroNation use technology to stimulate the brain’s ability to form new connections to achieve better health and cognitive recovery for our users. We do it with a community of scientists, clinicians and more than 16 million people all over the world.

With Gamification in our DNA, we help people stay motivated while training their memory, concentration, and intelligence. As a result, NeuroNation has received awards from major health insurance companies such as the AOK, funded by the German Federal Ministry of Health.

We start new projects and open new roles for mid and senior-level developers, who can help us help millions of people to stay fit or regain their cognitive skills. If you are interested in solid microservices, REST APIs and enjoy building useful web apps, let’s talk.

What can you do?

  • Contribute to our microservice architecture with your ideas and best practices in software development.
  • Take ownership of our code and ensure its efficiency and stability.
  • Work with solid backend solutions.
  • Work together with a professional cross-functional team.
  • Have direct impact on the success of our products.

What should you bring?

  • Advanced knowledge of PHP5/7.
  • High proficiency on advanced SQL for big tables, high performance and availability.
  • Solid experience working with OOP, REST APIs, Automated Testing, related concepts and frameworks
  • Habit of writing clear, understandable and well-documented code
  • Curiosity and openness to learn and solve problems using new technologies
  • Work permit for Germany / EU
  • As a plus, you also have some experience with any of the following: Slim, Lavarel, Lumen, Stripe, PayPal, Heroku, AWS, Vagrant, Docker, SilverStripe,

Our offer

  • Create technology of real value to people
  • Create exciting and useful technology, instead of spending your life with boring corporate, agency and advertising jobs
  • Revolutionize the health system
  • Competitive remuneration
  • Agile working environment and cross-functional team
  • Flexible working hours and home office options Coaching, learning and education budgets to move your career forward

To apply, please send your latest CV, cover letter, possible starting date and salary expectations via email to jobs@neuronation.de with the subject “Web Developer Application”.

title: Senior Software Engineer iOS
description:
Senior Software Engineer iOS

Remote job

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer iOS Swift, responsible for the development and maintenance of the iOS version of Pictural. Pictural is aiming to be a universal app that runs on various iPhone and iPad models. Your focus is helping development of the iOS App. We are an experienced team who pays attention to details and wants to make every bit of the app as great for our users as it can be.

Job requirements

  • Proficient with Swift.
  • Experience in Objective-C and/or C/C++.
  • Experience with iOS frameworks such as Photos, Core Data, Core Animation, Core ML, WatchOS, etc.
  • Experience with image processing, GCD, and performance tuning.
  • Understanding of Apple’s design principles and interface guidelines.
  • Knowledge of low-level C-based libraries such as OpenCV is preferred.
  • Experience with performance and memory tuning with tools.
  • Proficient understanding of Git.
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services.

Personal qualifications

  • Fluent in spoken and written English.
  • Good communication skills to express ideas and opinions.
  • Tendency to perfection of UX and UI.
  • High quality standards of coding.

Education

  • Bachelor or Master in Computer Science or similar.
  • Basic knowledge in Computer Vision is a plus.

What we offer

A friendly, competent, distributed, and multi-national team. Rewarding user feedback from thousands of users. Remote working environment with flexible working hours. Job security: We are seeking only reliable long-term employees with permanent contract. No recruiter offers wanted!!

Contact us

Please send your application in English to jobs@pictural.ai and make sure to include a link to your Github/Bitbucket account and/or app examples you are proud of. You can also apply via the application form.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

title: C# .NET Developer
description:
C# .NET developer

E-commerce Marketplace SaaS platform Leiden, 32 tot 40 uur per week

Voor ons snelgroeiende Software as a Software (SaaS)-bedrijf ChannelEngine zoeken wij een C# .NET Developer! Word jij gelukkig van programmeren, heb je ervaring met web development en lijkt het je leuk om onderdeel te zijn van ons team? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

Wat is ChannelEngine?

ChannelEngine is een snelgroeiend SaaS-platform dat webshops, ERP’s en elk ander pakket aan Europese online marketplaces koppelt. Grote partijen zoals Amazon, Bol.com, eBay, Cdiscount, Carrefour, Otto en vele anderen zijn partner van ons. Daarnaast werken wij voor mooie klanten zoals Gall & Gall, Travelbags, Omoda en Body & Fit.

Via ChannelEngine kan een bedrijf haar producten direct online aanbieden op meerdere marketplaces tegelijk. De bestellingen worden vanaf de kanalen opgehaald en in de omgeving van de klant verwerkt voor verdere afhandeling. De terugkoppeling van een zendingen gebeurt vervolgens ook via ChannelEngine, waardoor het hele traject op effectieve wijze geautomatiseerd kan worden. Door deze volledig automatische afhandeling kunnen onze klanten vanuit hun eigen systeem veel extra verkoopkanalen bedienen.

Wat wordt er van jou verwacht?

Wegens de snelle groei van de afgelopen maanden zijn wij op zoek naar een Developer die ons team van ambitieuze developers kan versterken met het uitdenken en ontwikkelen van nieuwe functionaliteiten en koppelingen. Doordat het platform schaalbaar is opgezet kunnen we continu door ontwikkelen. Wij developen op basis van SCRUM en werken o.a. met C#, ASP.NET MVC, MS SQL en Angular. Als developer werk je bij ons in een zeer ervaren, gedreven en enthousiast team.

Om de C# .NET Developer op de juiste manier te kunnen invullen, vinden wij het belangrijk dat jij beschikt over de volgende kwaliteiten:

  • Je hebt ervaring met web development, databases en API's.
  • Bij voorkeur beschik je over een relevante hbo- of wo-opleiding.
  • Je denkt graag mee in een informele en snelgroeiende startup.
  • Ervaringmet e-commerce en systeemintegraties is een pre.
  • Je beschikt over goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
  • Je hebt veel plezier in programmeren en zorgt dat je op de hoogte bent van de nieuwste technieken zoals bijvoorbeeld .NET core.
  • Je hebt ervaring met C#, ASP.NET MVC en SQL Server.

Kortom, wil jij...

  • Een afwisselende baan in een gedreven, kleinschalig en niet-hiërarchisch team?
  • Ruimte en verantwoordelijkheid om jouw eigen tijd in te delen?
  • Meegroeien met een snelgroeiend bedrijf met grote internationale plannen en ambities?
  • Ontwikkelen aan een eigen internationaal e-commerce platform?
  • Gezellige collega’s met gezamenlijke lunch en flexibele werktijden?
  • Een fijne werkplek in een historisch pand in het centrum van Leiden?
  • Ergonomische werkplekken, zit-sta-bureaus en supersnelle PC of laptop met twee beeldschermen?
  • Darten in je pauzes, stoelmassages, vers fruit en heerlijke koffie van versgemalen bonen?

Interesse?

Heb je meerdere vragen met ja beantwoord? Solliciteer dan direct! Mail naar jobs@channelengine.com of bel 071-528 87 95. Kijk voor meer informatie over de organisatie op onze website www.channelengine.com/nl/company/about-us.

Ready to go?

This is the time to get in. Please send us your resume and a detailed cover letter that explains why you’d be a good fit for the team via the application form.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Software ontwikkelaar .NET
description:
De Onderlinge ’s-Gravenhage is een onafhankelijke pensioen- en levensverzekeraar in Den Haag. Met onze producten bieden wij onze klanten financiële zekerheid. We staan voor belangrijke vernieuwingen op het gebied van productontwikkeling, ICT en communicatie. Je wordt gestimuleerd om je ideeën te delen en projectmatig te werken. Onze kerncompetenties zijn: deskundig, inlevend, proactief en resultaatgericht.

De afdeling ICT vormt een essentiële schakel in het continu verbeteren van bedrijfsprocessen.

Voor de afdeling Systeemontwikkeling binnen de sector ICT zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste en initiatiefrijke software ontwikkelaar .NET.

Software Ontwikkelaar .NET

De uitdaging

In deze zelfstandige functie met veel ruimte voor innovatie ben je verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling van informatiesystemen op basis van een functionele specificatie. Je bouwt en test programmatuur en je houdt je bezig met het voorbereiden en uitvoeren van systeemtesten. Je voert ook regelmatig reviews uit. Verder zorg je voor het opstellen, actueel houden en beheren van systeemdocumentatie. In deze functie werk je nauw samen met de functioneel ontwerper en de gebruikers, veelal in multidisciplinair projectverband.

Jouw profiel

Je beschikt over een voor de functie relevante (Bachelors/HBO) opleiding, aangevuld met meerdere jaren ervaring als ontwikkelaar in een .NET/C# omgeving. Tevens heb je relevante ervaring met de technieken WCF, MVC en Javascript. Je hebt kennis van en/of ervaring met SOA concepten, object oriëntatie en Oracle databases en de toepassing ervan in een complex administratieve automatisering. Kennis van KnockoutJS, React.js, ASP.Net core2.2, WebAPI, Oracle en MSSQL is een sterke pré. Naast analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden beschik je over een proactieve instelling, heb je een goed ontwikkeld inlevingsvermogen en ben je resultaatgericht. Daarbij is belangrijk dat je zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband kunt werken en spreekt het je aan met andere vakdisciplines samen te werken.

Wij bieden

Een brede functie met ruime ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden binnen een professionele, ambitieuze en solide organisatie. Een prettige, informele werkomgeving met korte communicatielijnen, waar ruimte is voor eigen inbreng, initiatieven en persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Arbeidsvoorwaarden conform de CAO voor het Verzekeringsbedrijf, aangevuld met diverse bedrijfsregelingen, waaronder een 13e maand en flexibele werktijden.

Ben jij de ICT professional die wij zoeken?

Dan ontvangen wij graag je sollicitatie met CV! Stuur je sollicitatie naar hrm@ogmail.nl. Voor vragen over de functie kun je contact opnemen met de manager ICT Systeemontwikkeling Carmen Boksteen, telefoonnummer 070 - 342 13 65.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Data Engineer (Spark, Python, Scala)
description:
Data Engineer (Spark, Python, Scala)

Westblaak 175, Rotterdam, Netherlands Full-time Department: Engineering Level of education: Bachelor's degree

Job Description

Build new product solutions and solve complex problems in the field of Data Engineering. That’s what we love to do! Being part of VONQ’s Engineering team means adding value and making a positive impact on the market. Do you also find AI in general and machine learning in particular intriguing? Apply for Data Engineer at VONQ in Rotterdam!

Data Engineer

Rotterdam, fulltime, ASAP

Work on a unique product and deal with Data Engineering challenges every day!

As one of our Data Engineers, you’ll have a huge contribution to our flagship product: the Job Marketing Platform (JMP). It’s a data-driven application with a recommendation engine that advises recruiters how they should reach their target audience online. The platform is used daily by many clients, and we have an ambitious roadmap to build it out further!

Your challenge? You’ll work on the analytics part of our platform where we provide insights to our customers on how applicants act while applying to a certain position. You’ll engineer data pipelines to integrate data sources from tracking systems (Snowplow) and other systems to build and visualize insights!

How you get the job done

  • Work in a multidisciplinary agile team
  • Take part in critical product design efforts and hands-on with the implementation
  • Contribute to the scalable streaming data processing application, environment and tools for resources efficiency
  • Work with Big Data and web tracking technologies
  • Engineer pipelines for processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data
  • Design and develop microservices as data consumers
  • Be hands-on with AWS infrastructure and relational databases

You will be part of an international and experienced Engineering department consisting of Backend and Frontend Developers, Data- and DevOps Engineers, Designers, an Agile Coach and a CTO.

What our perfect picture looks like

This describes the ideal candidate, but above all, we value people that are eager to grow, autonomous, work together, and love to get things done!

  • 3+ years of experience in Data Engineering or related sphere
  • Bachelor degree or equivalent relevant work experience
  • Experience with working in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban)
  • Excellent communication skills in English
  • Experience with programming in Scala or Python is required
  • Experience in working with data (integration of data from multiple data sources, building ETL pipelines, API development etc) is strongly desirable
  • A DevOps mindset is needed, experience with AWS infrastructure is a big plus

Bonus points!

  • Experience with Apache Spark
  • Experience with web tracking technologies is a big plus (we use Snowplow)
  • Understanding of distributed computing principles and streaming applications
  • Understanding of microservices concept is appreciated

This is why you can’t miss out on this opportunity

We promise that at VONQ you’ll never stop learning! You’ll be surrounded by international and experienced colleagues, so prepare yourself for some interesting and intellectual conversations.

Our product still has a lot of potential to grow, and YOU can make an impact on that. You’ll get freedom and space for own initiatives, in fact, we encourage you!

We have legendary company outings, beers on Friday and lots of FUN!

There is more! We offer:

  • A good salary, 8% holiday allowance
  • 100% commuting expenses compensation
  • Pension contribution
  • Flexible working hours
  • Unlimited (paid!) holidays
  • Time and budget for training
  • Relocation support and more!

Are you up for the challenge? Click here to apply! Questions? You can reach out to info@vonq.com!

title: Full-time Contract Interaction Designer (junior to mid level)
description:
Starting immediately till March 2020, working onsite in the South Bay, the contract Interaction Designer will be responsible for translating user experience narratives into pseudocode and other interaction design implementation tools. -Japanese-English bilingual is a plus

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
More than 7 billion people depend on farms for healthy and affordable food. By 2050, the global population will reach 9.4 billion, and farmers will need new ways to deliver on this demand. They’ll be seeking options that are economically viable and help them remain environmentally sustainable. Granular's software meets this need, making farmers more efficient.

We’re looking for an Android Engineer to join our Granular Business team. You will build new features for the native mobile app and help advance our mobile architecture and frameworks. You will work closely with mobile, backend, and web engineers, along with Product and Design partners. This role is integral to Granular's success and is a unique opportunity to join a mission-focused, dynamic, and creative team!

What You’ll Get To Do:

Influence, build, and own product features and technical design. Collaborate with product managers, designers, and QA engineers. Engage in mentorship to develop and refine your skillset, while offering your own perspective. Deliver well-designed, maintainable solutions in a Lean/Agile environment, on a small team with light process. Produce high-quality software that is unit-tested and code-reviewed. Our Ideal Candidate:

4+ years of software development experience. Prior experience in shipping high-quality applications to the Play Store with at least one app currently listed. Attention to detail in code quality and translating design wireframes to native implementation. Knowledge of the Android platform and backward compatibility to Lollipop. Experience with Kotlin and native Android UI. Desire to gain experience in how mobile apps work in the real world, including unreliable network coverage, location services, different device capabilities, battery life, and performance tuning. User-centric approach to app development. Familiarity with API design. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, able to take initiative and build strong, positive relationships. B.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field a plus, but we know great engineers come from many walks of life.

Perks and Benefits:

Upward mobility. We are growing and need talent who can take on increasingly challenging and rewarding roles Generous Vacation 401k Matching Program Employer sponsored Medical, Dental, and Vision Vision, Dental and Dependent Care FSA Family, Maternity and Paternity Leave Learning and Development Programs Open floor plan and dog-friendly offices Who We Are:

Granular combines the leadership and innovation of experienced entrepreneurs, advisors, and investors with the meaningful insights of farmers, agronomists, data scientists and engineers.

Our internal team has the focused, innovative business and technical acumen that defines Silicon Valley; this expertise has produced products including Granular Business, Granular Agronomy, AcreValue, and AgStudio.

Founded in February 2014, and backed by leading VC’s like Andreessen Horowitz and Google Ventures, Granular is an independent subsidiary of Corteva, a spin off of DowDuPont™. We currently have offices in San Francisco, CA, Champaign, IL, Johnston, IA, Cumming, GA and São Paulo, Brazil. Learn more about our company and people here!

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
Job Description:

What makes Gartner a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a fast-growing team that helps the world become smarter and more connected. We’re the world’s leading research and advisory company, achieving consistent double-digit growth by steering clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they can’t find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment, exceptional training and career development — as well as unlimited growth opportunities. If you like working with a curious, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is the place for you.

The ideal candidate has a passion for coding and keeping up with the latest in software development and technology. You must be excited to find creative solutions to interesting coding challenges. This position works closely with our designers and engineers to build a compelling product and implement exciting new features--all with the goal of ensuring a great experience for website users. Familiarity with OS-specific APIs and demonstrated experience launching production-ready code is a must.

What you’ll need:

A University Degree (preferably in Computer Science) 4-10+ years of professional working experience using the following: Object-Oriented Programming techniques (much of our back end is built in Ruby) JavaScript frameworks (we use ReactJS) MySQL Linux

What you’ll do:

Code. You'll spend your days writing new classes, solving interesting problems, thinking of clever algorithms and implementing solutions using techniques like web sockets and REST APIs. Write unit tests and test your code. We don t like bugs, and neither should you. We need your code to be reliable and reusable years for years to come. Learn new technologies. We're always trying new things and you should too. You ll be expected to keep getting better and learn new technical skills. Deliver products and tools that drive our business. The tools and features you ll work on will grow our company even faster, and help our teams and leaders do their jobs more efficiently.

Who you are:

A team player. You get along well with your colleagues and are always ready to help get things done. You enjoy working on projects with multiple people and share knowledge. Passionate about learning. You thrive on complex technical challenges and are always eager to learn the latest technologies. Organized and detailed-oriented. You think ahead of time about how best to implement new features, and your code is clean, well-organized and properly documented.

What we offer:

A collaborative, positive culture. You’ll work with people who are as enthusiastic, smart and driven as you are. You’ll be managed by the best too. Limitless growth and learning opportunities. We offer the excitement of a fast-paced entrepreneurial workplace and the professional growth opportunities of an established global organization. Outstanding compensation. We offer a competitive salary and generous benefits; including a robust time off allowance and great perks. #DigitalMarkets

title: Digital Developer
description:
Summary

The Digital Developer creates, manages and optimizes Casey Trees’ web content, promoting the organization, its programs and brand to increase its constituency and support base.

Apply Here

Essential Functions

  • Develops website content; establishes/maintains website architecture; designs page layouts; writes copy; creates user interface elements; fulfills web updates and publications organization-wide
  • Integrates the website with Salesforce CRM and other third-party platforms, ensuring users can intuitively sign up for updates, donate, purchase merchandise, volunteer, and easily participate in all Casey Trees’ programs and activities
  • Develops microsites for specifics topics, actions or audiences, including layout, user research and wireframe creation in HTML, CSS, JavaScript and other programming languages to translate designs for the web
  • Conducts testing to evaluate the effectiveness, efficiency and user satisfaction; implements changes to improve information architecture, navigation, content clarity and memorability
  • Analyzes web traffic; runs Google AdWords campaigns to gain insight on user behavior and acquisition; tracks landing page quality and improves SEO
  • Maintains consistent organizational/campaign branding for the website and related projects
  • Identifies/creates new opportunities for digital communications in consultation with internal departments and colleagues
  • Manages website contract support; develops contract specifications, interfaces with contractors and management of deliverables; explores options for vendors for website design, development, and services as necessary
  • Stays abreast of new features to determine their value to organization; coordinates adopts/implements modifications as appropriate/needed/instructed
  • Maintains library of responsive email templates; troubleshoots display issues across email clients
  • Connects people to trees
  • Performs other related duties as assigned

Working Conditions

Work is conducted primarily in an office setting with some exceptions. See “Physical Demands.”

Physical Demands

  • While this is primarily a desk job, all CT employees may engage in tree planting/related activities in outdoor environments, year-round in the heat, cold and inclement weather and must have suitable clothing. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act.
  • While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to talk, hear, stand, walk, use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The incumbent is occasionally required to lift/move up to 25 pounds, lift files, open filing cabinets, bend or stand on a stool, etc.

Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time exempt position, 40-hours a week. The incumbent must be able and willing to work evenings, weekends, and extended hours when needed.

Travel

Travel is primarily local, although some out of the area travel and overnights may be expected.

Compensation/Benefits

Competitive salary with excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, retirement plan, paid holidays, and paid time off.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, communications, graphic design, or related field; or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Two or more years of experience working with web content management systems
  • Strong project management, data management, information architecture, and support skills
  • Experience with implementing websites in HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • Solid writing and editing skills, including strong knowledge with AP and Chicago style
  • Proficient using Adobe Creative Suite
  • A demonstrated eye for clean design in graphic and web layout
  • Strong ability to set and meet deadlines, manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize assignments
  • People-oriented person who can work with individuals at all levels and abilities and explain technical concepts to non-technical people
  • Commitment to the mission, vision and values of Casey Trees
  • Interest in fundraising, storytelling and creative presentation of writing
  • Must be willing to grow and change as the organization changes

Preferred Qualifications

  • Certification or experience in Salesforce
  • Experience with other programming languages, including Python or JavaScript
  • Understanding of APIs and third-party data integration processes
  • Experience using Bootstrap and GitHub
  • Familiarity with WordPress

Apply Here

Casey Trees is a Washington D.C.-based nonprofit committed to restoring, enhancing and protecting the tree canopy of the nation's capital. For more information visit our website at www.caseytrees.org.

Casey Trees is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Casey Trees does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Software Developer
description:
Overview Meritize is an education lender that uses an individual’s academic, military and work achievements to enhance credit evaluation and expand funding for skills-based education. The company’s proprietary merit-based lending program goes beyond traditional underwriting to leverage individual academic and experiential data, resulting in increased access to educational funding and improved outcomes. The Meritize platform promotes the growth and development of skills-based careers on behalf of students, educators and employers through innovative funding solutions, skills building programs and career success services.

We are actively expanding our software design and development practice and looking for talented individuals to join the team.

About You You have a passion for high-quality, reliable and maintainable code. You’re comfortable working side by side with product managers, designers, and other developers, making decisions together in order to quickly deliver valuable working software to our users. You’re agile and retrospective, and not afraid to identify what we’re doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we're doing right so we can improve on it. Above all, you judge your success by the success of your team and the happiness of our users.

Responsibilities If you are looking to work alongside a team of highly energetic, passionate and driven people, then this opportunity may be for you. Reporting to VP, Head of Development, here are the required skills/experience:

  • 2+ years of Software Development experience in one or more programming languages
  • Empathy and strong communication skills
  • Interest in a pair-programming environment
  • Passionate about growing your skills, tackling interesting work and challenging problems
  • BA/BS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience

Desired Skills/Experience The following skills/experience is strongly desired:

  • Building and deploying cloud-based enterprise software in a continuous delivery environment
  • Experience in Test Driven Development (TDD) and agile methodologies
  • Experience in developing and deploying applications on AWS

Meritize is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Ruby On Rails back-end developer
description:
Do you want to make a contribution to social and environmental impact?

We are looking for an individual back-end developer to join our team on a contract basis. You will work from home as part of a small team taking our radical www.oneplanet.com platform to the next level.

title: Senior Fullstack Ruby / JS Developer (Remote or Berlin)
description:
About us

We are looking for people who are up to the task of digitizing the job advertising market with us. GOhiring offers digital infrastructure for companies, HR IT-systems, job portals and agencies to enable more direct and productive ways of collaborating. That way, job postings can be published via an API and managed with transparency via digital processes. Thanks to state-of-the-art tools, we have also digitized our own working environment and set up everything for #remote work from anywhere in the world.

Your role

  • As part of our development team, you will be responsible for building smart, customer-driven front- and back-end solutions
  • This implies solving exciting engineering challenges, starting with MVP’s and iterating from there
  • You collaborate closely with our experienced team of backend developers, product managers, designers and testers
  • You work on complex frontend projects using the latest technology and JS frameworks (such as react.js, ember.js)
  • Depending on your interests and skills, you will work on different parts of our product ecosystem

Your profile

  • You get excited about good quality code and engineering quests
  • You have at least five years experience in web development and +3 years in Ruby (fullstack) and Javascript frameworks. More languages as a bonus.
  • You value testing, well-documented code and intelligent software design techniques
  • You already have good knowledge about API Design and performance optimization
  • You are conversant in English

What to expect

Remote culture - Work wherever you are most productive - at home, while traveling or in our office in Berlin. Benefit from processes and mindsets which are 100% oriented towards working flexible hours in the location of your choice.

Small, agile team - We believe that work is simply more fun in small teams. Experienced colleagues, jointly defined company targets, a direct exchange and lots of creative leeway: That is what constitutes our understanding of productivity.

Complex challenges - Due to our central role in the market, we are closely interlinked with all the players and are able to reach unparalleled depths when it comes to digitizing business processes. In doing so, we encounter new challenges time and time which are waiting to be solved for the benefit of all market players.

Sounds like an interesting challenge for you?

We believe in culture first, skills second: if you are truly interested in this job, you should apply - even if you do not fulfill 100% of the requirements. Because a cultural fit is more important to us than an extra grain of qualification.

Simply send us your profile in addition to your Github handle. We look forward to getting to know you better!

Diversity and equal opportunity are important to us. We are happy about the interest of all candidates and strive to provide feedback as quickly as possible.

title: Java Software Engineer / Web/ Spring /Backend/TDD/Agile
description:
We are looking for the best Java Software Engineer! Our future colleague can be based anywhere in Spain.

Your key tasks will be:

  • You will be part of our Agile TV Product team to bring recognized products and services to market, building the best TV experience.
  • Participate in the development of new products and evolvement of the existing ones while contributing in the architectural decisions (e.g.: New Generation TV Platform).
  • Collaborate in designing and implementing new features required to support backend modules and platform functionality and releases.
  • Assist in delivering analysis and development for high performance, reliable, secure and scalable applications.

You must have:

  • 2 + years of experience in Java and web development.
  • Understanding of object-oriented fundamentals.
  • Knowledge in the Spring IO platform (Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Data…).
  • Experience in software development best practices, including optimization, documentation and testing.
  • Experience in developing robust, highly scalable systems.
  • Handling software repositories and the GIT version control.
  • Experience in agile methodologies (SCRUM, Kanban ...).
  • B2 English level or equivalent.
  • Knowledge of SQL databases.

It would be great if you:

  • Are familiar with:
  • Content Delivery Optimization (Ngnix, Varnish, Hazelcast).
  • Deployment solutions (Docker, Vagrant)
  • TV Technologies (streaming, DRM)
  • Non-sql technologies (MongoDB)
  • JS frameworks (React, React Native, NodeJS)
  • Have:
  • Certificate of Higher Education in Computer Science or bachelor’s in computer science
  • Experiencie with TDD.

We are looking forward to hearing from you if:

  • You are a collaborative team player, self-motivated individual who takes ownership, eager to learn and willing to take challenges, hands on and flexible.
  • You have good communication and organisation skills and solid analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Why join us?

  • Thrilling projects and products are waiting for you. Lots of things to do, a bunch of talented people to work with and a real technological challenge. Ready to foster innovation?.
  • Your family and friends will see the outcomes of your job. How terrific is that!!!.
  • You will be connected to some of the coolest brands and bigger companies worldwide.
  • Because we believe your personal life is as important as your career, you can enjoy flexibility in terms of location, working hours...
  • Your colleagues will be from different nationalities, cultures and backgrounds.
  • Willing to be feel empowered in an ongoing learning environment? Would you like to attend industry events and summits? If so, this is the place for you.

title: .NET Software Engineer (Radiant)
description:
About us: At Baker Hughes, we are transforming the future of energy. With operations in over 120 countries, we are developing and deploying industry-leading technologies and services to take energy forward.

For more than a century, our inventions have revolutionized energy. Today, we are bringing our expertise to make oil and gas safer, cleaner, and more efficient.

Our people are the trusted experts, relied on to solve customer challenges big and small. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent, and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

We believe in creating an environment of diversity and inclusion, without bias. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged, and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work.

We’re makers, inventors, and leaders who aren’t afraid of the tough challenges. We believe pushing boundaries will help to lead the way for a new energy future.

.NET Software Engineer (Radiant)

Our company is currently in search of several talented Software Developers to help increase our dynamic, growing Development Teams in Delft (Zuid-Holland). As part of one of our 10+ Scrum teams, you will be working together with the Product Owner and Domain Experts on our application, JewelSuite and our current platform, JewelEarth.

The JewelSuite™ Subsurface Modeling application is an innovative, powerful tool to quickly create precise geological models—regardless of the reservoir’s structural complexity—in half the time as traditional solutions. The application can rapidly build multiple scenarios and accelerates analysis of alternative possible outcomes for determining optimal field development plans. The JewelEarth™ software platform provides (API) services, user interface components, domain objects, commands and serialization capabilities that are the foundational functionality for all JewelSuite™ software applications. The JewelEarth™ SDK enables you to easily build your own differentiating software applications, create workflow standards through set workflow panels, and connect to proprietary databases or other subsurface applications.

You will help us deliver our products quickly and with high quality by:

  • Taking ownership of the software development process
  • Pro-actively contributing to continuously improve our code and development processes
  • Being passionate about working in a product development environment
  • Showing craftsmanship and being passionate about quality
  • Being motivated by complex architecture and code
  • Being passionate about helping our products to stay “future-proof”
  • Adding value to the team through your knowledge and programming skills. With your team grow in achieving unique and outstanding performance
  • Enjoying to learn from your motivated and skilled colleagues and in turn sharing your knowledge
  • Not afraid to ask questions and excel in your profession

What are we looking for

  • Bachelors’ degree or higher in Computer Science or equivalent with significant experience in software development
  • In depth knowledge of Microsoft technologies including Visual Studio and C#
  • Thorough knowledge of software architecture, object oriented design, unit testing, and best practices (e.g.: SOLID, TDD, BDD etc.)
  • Experience working with complex structures, multi-threading, design patterns
  • Experience with Scrum/Agile software development
  • Experience in technical or scientific software engineering is a plus
  • Excellent English communications skills (verbal and written)

What’s in it for you

  • Working in a multicultural and with multiple other teams in a project following Scrum/SAFe principles
  • Working together with domain experts on exciting scientific software in the Oil & Gas domain
  • Being part of a passionate community of development professionals
  • Access to self-learning resources (e.g. PluralSight)
  • Our commitment for the long run (by providing trainings, career growth, knowledge sharing)
  • Flexible working hours
  • Bonus program
  • Healthcare allowance (€ 138,70 gross per month)
  • 25 Vacation days, the year after (if not been ill) 5 days extra
  • As part of our Continuous Improvement we are open for your ideas

Baker Hughes is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Learn more.
how_to_apply:
If you want to apply then leave your resume and motivation behind via our online application form.

Acquisition as a result of this vacancy is not appreciated.

title: Senior Backend Software Engineer (Ruby)
description:
What makes Gartner a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a fast-growing team that helps the world become smarter and more connected. We’re the world’s leading research and advisory company, achieving consistent double-digit growth by steering clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they can’t find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment, exceptional training and career development — as well as unlimited growth opportunities. If you like working with a curious, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is the place for you.

About Gartner Digital Markets: Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology decisions and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three leading brands—Capterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming.

What we are looking for: GetApp is looking for a passionate Senior Backend Software Engineer to work with our highly skilled technology team located in central Barcelona.

This position will make an impact on the design of backend architecture for our applications, whilst working closely with our designers and engineers to build a compelling product and implement exciting new features - all with the goal of ensuring a great experience for website users.

Why you will want to come to the office everyday: Your primary responsibility will be development and maintenance of the backend part of the GetApp website codebase ensuring the highest quality experience for our users.

Responsible for the timely development of well-defined, larger product features/changes, expected to use judgement & apply functional knowledge of methodology/best practices; Develop code documentation as a reference.

Become active participant in technical design process, expected to contribute own ideas for changes/new features; Capable of owning independent small-to-medium features all the way through from technical design to launch.

Improves operations by conducting systems analysis; recommending changes in policies and procedures.

Challenging projects: You will work on the main website, recommendation systems, chatbot and many other.

Web technologies: Ruby is our language of choice, the stack is composed of MySQL, Solr, Redis, AWS (including Personalize), Google Cloud Services and others. We actively use Docker to power our infrastructure.

What you will bring to the team: A passion for technology and development, a hunger to learn, a desire to meet challenges, a commitment to applying engineering best practice to produce top quality solutions.

4 years+ experience in Ruby.

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.

Knowledge of software development methodology, techniques & standards.

Understanding of software design concepts, patterns, tools, best practices.

Knowledge of web frameworks (like Sinatra/Rails), testing frameworks (like Rspec/Minitest) and Javascript.

MySQL and Apache Solr is a plus.

Verbal English skills (we work in English!)

What we offer: Limitless growth and learning opportunities.

A collaborative and positive culture — join a diverse team of professionals that are as smart and driven as you.

A chance to make an impact — Your work will contribute directly to our strategy.

Frequent social activities such as laser tag, bowling, escape room, summer beach party, hiking & bbq, and more!

Modern approach to work - Flexible hours, Friday afternoons free, remote work, and more.

Office close to the beach in the fantastic, “innovation and tech” @22 district of sunny Barcelona.

Fresh fruit, snacks, selection of teas and fair trade organic coffee.

Relocation Assistance - A specialist to help you with all the appointments and paperwork.

What you will get: Competitive compensation.

23 days annual holiday, and additional days off for your birthday, 24th & 31st of December.

Private Medical and Dental Care.

Life and Disability Insurance.

Public Transport Subsidy.

Ticket Restaurant Card.

Childcare Vouchers (Ticket Guarderia).

IncentiFit - annual reimbursement for health-and-wellness-related activities.

Pension Scheme.

Tuition Reimbursement.

Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

Employee Assistance Program.

Gartner Gives Charity Match.

Who we are: Action Oriented - Deliver fast, get great results. We embrace the vision, roadmap to success and the action it takes to make it happen.

Intellectually Curious - Seek to learn, love to teach. We’re humble and embrace respectful, radical candor with a mindset of ongoing professional and personal development.

Collaborative - One team, shared mission. We welcome feedback and understand the value of working together to accomplish more than what is possible individually.

#digitalmarkets

title: Abteilungsleiter (m/w/d) Anwendungsmanagement ERP/SAP
description:
Gestalten Sie mit uns eine der größten und komplexesten IT-Landschaften Deutschlands und unterstützen Sie unser Team als

Abteilungsleiter (m/w/d) Anwendungsmanagement ERP/SAP

ab sofort und in Vollzeit in Bonn.

Als IT-Partner der Bundeswehr und IT-Dienstleistungszentrum des Bundes bieten wir umfassende IT-Services aus einer Hand. Mit über 4.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern zählen wir zu den zehn größten IT-Service-Providern Deutschlands. Wir suchen authentische IT-Liebhaberinnen und IT-Liebhaber, die ihre Leidenschaft mit uns teilen wollen, auf der Suche nach anspruchsvollen IT-Herausforderungen sind und Deutschlands IT gestalten möchten.

Die Business Unit (BU) ERP ist der verlässliche sowie leistungsstarke Partner für alle Phasen von ERP Projekten – im Schwerpunkt SAP – insbesondere für die Abteilung G des Bundesamtes für Ausrüstung, Informationstechnik und Nutzung der Bundeswehr (BAAINBw) und zukünftig für die Behörden des Bundes. Die BU ERP Anwendungsmanagement umfasst das Application Management über den gesamten Produktlebenszyklus. Der Bereich treibt Innovationen zur SAP- und Non-SAP-Landschaft des Kunden verantwortlich voran. Aufgrund der hohen Verzahnung erfolgt eine enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Digitalisierungsprogrammen, der BU Bw sowie der Shared Service Delivery. Standardisierung, Re-Engineering und Automatisierung sind dabei wichtige Rahmenparameter.

Erfahren Sie mehr in unserem Portfolio.

Ihre Aufgaben:

  • Fachliche und disziplinarische Führung eines elfköpfigen Teams
  • Sicherstellung einer qualitativ hochwertigen Vertragserfüllung durch störungsfreien SLA-konformen Applikationsbetrieb für das verantwortete Portfolio Legacy-Systeme und SAP
  • Aktives Vorantreiben des Zukunftsprojektes SAP@Cloud im Rahmen des verantworteten Portfolios
  • Verantwortliche Umsetzung und Betrieb von standardisierten Lösungen im Rahmen der verantworteten Verfahren gemäß den Kundenanforderungen unter Einbindung externer Partner
  • Intensive Kundenkommunikation und Gremienvertretung
  • Sicherstellung der fachlichen und prozessualen Abstimmung innerhalb der BWI in allen Fragen der Leistungserbringung des verantworteten Portfolios
  • Personalverantwortliche Entwicklung und Förderung der MitarbeiterInnen sowie aktives Umsetzen der Unternehmensstrategien und Werte der BWI
  • Sicherstellung des Skill-Aufbaus und Bereitstellung der für den Anwendungsbetrieb erforderlichen Ressourcen

Ihr Profil:

  • Abgeschlossenes IT-bezogenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik bzw. Nachweise gleichwertiger Fähigkeiten
  • Mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Führung eines Teams mit disziplinarischer Verantwortung
  • Expertise in der Managementberatung und im Portfoliomanagement
  • Sehr gute praktische und theoretische Kenntnisse im Themenfeld SAP Anwendungsmanagement
  • Umfassende Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen im Integrationsmanagement großer Anwendungsentwicklungs-Projekte und Steuerung externer Partner
  • ITIL-Kenntnisse mit entsprechenden Zertifizierungen
  • Profunde Kenntnisse im öffentlichen Vergaberecht
  • Fließende Deutschkenntnisse

Wir bieten:

  • Spannende und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben in einem innovativen und bedeutsamen Umfeld
  • Vielfältige interne und externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie individuelle Karrieremodelle
  • Coaching-Angebote und Möglichkeiten zur Persönlichkeitsentwicklung in einer wertschätzenden Arbeitsatmosphäre
  • Gratis Fitnessstudio-Mitgliedschaft über Interfit und weitere attraktive Mitarbeitervergünstigungen Vertrauensarbeitszeit. Je nach Aufgabenfeld sind mobiles Arbeiten und flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle möglich
  • Ein attraktives Vergütungspaket inkl. arbeitgeberfinanzierter betrieblicher Altersvorsorge
